Module org.example.my_project
Package org.example.my_project.BL

Class Diagrams

java.lang.Object
org.example.my_project.BL.Diagrams
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Diagrams extends Object implements Serializable
This class represents a collection of diagram shapes and contains methods to manipulate, add attributes, methods, and delete shapes from the diagram.
Since:
2024-12-05
Version:
1.0
Author:
Abdul Ahad, Tayyab, Zeeshan

  • Method Details

    • getShapes

      public static List<Shape> getShapes()
      Gets the list of all shapes in the diagram.
      Returns:
      A list of Shape objects representing all the shapes.

    • findShapeAt

      public Shape findShapeAt(double x, double y)
      Finds a shape at the given coordinates (x, y).
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate to check.
      y - The y-coordinate to check.
      Returns:
      The Shape at the given coordinates or null if no shape is found.

    • addAttributeToShape

      public void addAttributeToShape(ClassShape shape, String attribute)
      Adds an attribute to a given ClassShape.
      Parameters:
      shape - The ClassShape to which the attribute will be added.
      attribute - The attribute to add to the shape.

    • addMethodToShape

      public void addMethodToShape(ClassShape shape, String method)
      Adds a method to a given ClassShape. If the shape is an interface, the method is propagated to its generalizations.
      Parameters:
      shape - The ClassShape to which the method will be added.
      method - The method to add to the shape.

    • renameShape

      public void renameShape(Shape shape, String newName)
      Renames a shape and updates its connected shapes (associations, generalizations, etc.) accordingly.
      Parameters:
      shape - The shape to rename.
      newName - The new name for the shape.

    • deleteShape

      public Shape deleteShape(Shape shape)
      Deletes a shape from the diagram, as well as any associated shapes (e.g., associations, aggregations, compositions, generalizations).
      Parameters:
      shape - The shape to delete.
      Returns:
      The deleted shape.
